column1: beaten by a beauty! 142kph, good length shape in and nipping away! What a delivery! Dhawan caught on the crease and it just beat the edge
141kph, good length, some shape into Dhawan, top of off, he defends firmly to mid off
138kph, good length angled across the left-hander and he leaves
138kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he leaves
138kph, back of a length on leg, it hits the thigh pad and drops down
good length, 137kph, angled across the left-hander and he leaves
85kph, darted into off, he stands up and drive to midwicket
full on off, he drives to long on
tossed up outside off, he defends on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and pushing to the gap at wide mid off
full on off, he drives with ease to long on
91kph, tossed up, he drives in the air through a vacant cover, it just held up in the surface but Dhawan found the gap and the sweeper in the deep
cracked wide of mid off! A half volley, no swing, he thumps a drive past mid off and it races away to the rope
137kph, good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
136kph, good length, fifth stump line, angled across, he leaves
142kph, bouncer, Dhawan jumped down the track early but then bailed out of the shot and swayed inside it
138kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he tries to cut but gets a bottom edge onto the pitch
136kph, back of a length wide of off, he opens the face of the bat and steers it to third man
73kph, good length, he's back and forcing back to the bowler
attempted cut, gets a thick bottom edge through the legs of Carey! He had no chance of gloving that. They get two
sweep past short fine! Lovely shot. Maxwell drifts this down leg with the angle and Dhawan controls the stroke past short fine
fired down the leg side again and it's called wide
darted into off, he's back and defending
flatter on off, he punches back to the bowler
fired again down the leg side and Dhawan misses out trying to slap it fine but it's a wide
88kph tossed up outside off, he tries to drive but gets a thick edge to square leg
No-ball for overstepping 137kph, Dhawan charges and moves leg side, Hazlewood pitches back of a length and wide of off, Dhawan leaves
length ball in the slot, he miscues a heave to mid on and only gets one. It was caught by Labuschagne
glorious clip wide of mid on! Very full on middle, he used the bottom hand and placed this magnificently wide of mid on. Superb stroke
136kph, good length, fourth stump, just nipping away, he leaves wisely
136kph, good length fifth stump line, he leaves
137kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending to backward point
137kph, good length wide of off, he leaves again
full on off, he mistimes a drive but places it straight of cover for a single
134kph, full on leg, he glances this neatly to fine leg
138kph, fuller outside off, he drives but doesn't time it, picking out mid off
137kph, back of a length, on off, he chops this off the back foot towards point

chipped to cover! 132kph, good length, Dhawan advanced down the track to try and create a half-volley, he got there but played a strange shot, just checking a drive to Agar at cover, it was almost like he was giving catching practice and Agar could have caught it with his eyes closed.
136kph, good length outswinger, some nice shape, he leaves it alone
134kph, angled down the leg side and called wide
135kph, fuller length wide of off, he leans on an elegant drive beating cover for a couple
137kph, good length, top of off, he defends off the sticker of the bat to cover-point

top edge flies into the crowd at fine leg! It was a short ball into the ribs, he tried to control a pull shot, got a thick top edge and it flew way over the head of fine leg and was caught 8 rows back
back of a length on off, he's back and working this to midwicket
139kph, fuller length, he drives neatly but straight to cover
127kph, tempting outswinger, wide of off, he leaves watchfully
136kph, full on off, he clips this neatly with the angle but can't beat mid on
134kph, full length wide of off, he pushes a drive with the full face straight to cover-point
beautiful straight drive! Just leaned on it with the full face, beating a diving mid on and he timed it well enough to just beat Labuschagne's chase
good length outside off, he defends with an open face to point
132kph, short ball into the ribs, he pulls with control to wide fine leg
137kph, good length wide of off, he drives on the up to cover
133kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending
139kph, full on leg, he clips this straight to midwicket
141kph, fuller on off, he leans on a drive to mid on
138kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he's back and defending to point
cracking pull shot! 140kph, fractionally short and Kohli is all over it, pulling with the front knee up, smacking it past square leg
walks down and whips this past mid on! Sensational batting! 138kph, fuller length outside off, he walked down and turned it into a half-volley and pinged it between midwicket and mid on
137kph, back of a length outside off, he square drives on the up to point
133kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease
136kph, back of a length on off, he's back and working to midwicket
134kph, back of a length wide of off, he dabs a late cut straight to backward point
charges and backs away to leg but he misses trying to hammer a length ball with the horizontal bat over mid off
131kph, shorter length, he's back and turning this nicely to the gap at square leg
145kph, fuller on off, he mistimes a drive straight of mid on
140kph, good length fifth stump line, he edges trying to defend but it runs safely along the ground to third man
141kph, back of a length, it climbs and beats the edge wide of off
magnificent straight drive! Over-pitched outside off and he was all over it, thumping it with the full face straight of mid on
139kph, back of a length wide of off, he pushes this with a vertical bat to backward point and Smith makes a nice save
cracked over midwicket! 138kph, chest high short ball and Gill crunches a front foot pull straight over midwicket. Super shot
92kph, back of a length wide of off, he's back and crunching a back foot drive to deep cover
88kph, floated high and wide, he square drives to deep cover-point
sublime square drive on the up placed behind point, Henriques has a long chase from deep cover-point but he makes the diving save to save two
cut off the top edge over backward point! 92kph, wide short ball, almost too wide to reach, Kohli thrashed the hands at it and the top edge flew safely to the rope
drifting into off, he defends on the front foot
drifting into middle he clips this to midwicket and Maxwell misfields to allow one
136kph, length ball, he advances and checks a drive to mid off on the circle and they pinch one
back of a length on off, he's back and defending to backward point
fuller on middle, he works this square of midwicket
back of a length on middle, he tucks this to midwicket
134kph he lofts this fuller ball high over mid on, didn't nail it but they run well to get three
137kph, short and wide, he leans back and late cuts wide of third man and they run brilliantly to pick up two
85kph, drifting into middle, he drives to midwicket
full on leg, he pushes this with ease to long on
91kph, tossed up on middle, he defends from the crease
quicker ball, 99kph, he's back and mistiming this to midwicket
good length, 93kph, a hint of turn, it surprised Kohli as he defended
drifting into leg, he clips this straight to midwicket
88kph, quicker, length leg break, he's back and driving off the back foot past Zampa who misfields
89kph, fuller leg break, he drives to long off
93kph, quicker outside off, he drives towards long off but Zampa makes a nice diving save
93kph, drifting into middle, he drives towards long on and Maxwell makes the diving stop
91kph, fuller on leg, he drives to long on
1kph, fuller on leg, he drives to long off
full on leg, he drives but Agar fields
short length, he's back and tucking this around the corner
90kph, length ball on off, he sits back and defends

Given lbw! Gill takes his time but he finally reviews. Gill tried to sweep a delivery that pitched on off and slid on, it hit the front pad a fair way down and the umpire gave it out. Nothing on hot spot or RTS in terms of bat involved. Ball tracking says hitting in line and hitting the bails! It's umpire's call. Decision stands but India keep their two reviews
full and wide, he square drives powerfully to deep cover-point
98kph, darted down leg, he glances this to fine leg
90kph leg break outside off, he drives firmly to long off
drifting into leg, he clips this off his toes to deep midwicket
88kph, on off, he works against the turn to midwicket
91kph, he's back and tucking this to the gap at square leg
shorter length, he's back and punching to cover-point
fuller on off, he defends to cover
beaten trying to square drive off the back foot. 136kph, back of a length and it climbed past the edge
135kph, back of a length, fourth stump, he defends with soft hands behind point
play and miss again. 137kph, wide of off, again some extra bounce, he tried to run to third man but it beat the edge
136kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he's back and defending to backward point
136kph, fuller on off, he checks a firm drive to mid on
135kph, back of a length wide of off, he's back and guiding this to third man
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
short and quick, a bit of width, and Iyer uses that pace well, just jabs it away fine of backward point and it runs away quickly for four
flat one sliding onto the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, no turn, stays back and clips it square on the leg side
full on off stump, punched down to long-off
a bit more flight, just outside off. Stretches out and looks for that bottom-hand whip past short midwicket, but hits it straight to the fielder
short outside off, rises steeply above shoulder height, and Iyer jumps to ride the bounce and steer to third man
short, and again the bounce is steep, over Kohli's right shoulder. Beats him for pace on the hook
back of a length close to off stump, punched to deep point
shortish, nips in from just outside off to cramp the hopping Iyer for room. Blocked with soft hands into the cover region
short, angling slightly down leg, and Iyer pounces on it, swivelling to hook along the ground to the backward square leg boundary. Square leg and fine leg were back, but he bisected them
back of a length on off stump, defended to cover point
fullish, close to off stump, gets forward for a push into the covers
tossed up close to off stump, driven firmly to short extra-cover
flatter and quicker, quite full on off stump. Plants his front leg next to the line of the ball to open up the dabbed single to point
full on leg stump, whipped firmly to midwicket
full outside off, fairly quick. stretches out to push to deep cover point
nice length on off stump, Iyer is forward but not right up to the pitch. Defended with the turn to backward point
back of a length, looks like the wrong'un but doesn't turn a great deal, in towards middle and leg and he goes deep in his crease to punch to long-on
tossed up outside off, pushed to the left of extra-cover
flat and full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
flat, angling down leg, looks to sweep but only manages a bit of pad on it, dribbles down into the short fine leg region
flat, angling into middle and off, driven inside-out to deep cover
length ball on off stump, leans back, makes a bit of room, and dabs to short third man
flat length ball straightening towards off stump, punched off the back foot, straight back to the bowler
flighted delivery on off stump, stretches out and clips to long-on
full, fairly wide outside off, driven to deep cover
full on middle and leg, clipped through square leg

gone! Iyer was looking to force the pace there, trying to reverse some of the momentum Australia have built with these quiet overs. Full and quickish, on the stumps, and Iyer looks to make room to drive through - or maybe over - the covers. Ends up a little more leg-side of the ball than he wants, and the ball turns and he slices it into backward point's hands
tossed up on off stump, nice stretch out to defend back to Zampa
full on leg stump, gets his front leg out of the way and jabs it back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, punched to deep point
flat and quite full on middle and leg, clipped gently into the square leg region
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
a bit of flight on off stump, punched off the front foot to extra-cover
full on off stump, driven to long-off
thinks about stepping out but Agar bowls it flat and angles it into middle and leg so he checks himself and punches it back to the bowler
nice length close to off stump, may have been the wrong'un. Good stride out to defend into the off side
a bit of flight and he skips out, driven straight to short extra-cover
floated up on middle and off, the slowness allows him to get his feet into position to drive inside-out to the left of long-off
flat, back of a length, a bit of bounce over the top of off. Punched to long-off. With that bounce, it's hard to punch these square, with an angled bat, so you have to play straight
full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
full on off and middle, clipped to long-on
tossed up wide of off stump, reaches out and flat-bats to deep cover
length ball outside off, defended towards backward point

gone, that's not a good shot at all. It's quite full, it's on the stumps, and it's hugely risky to try and sweep those balls. This one passes under his bat, and he's been given out lbw. He's reviewed... Only bounce can save him, I think. No bat on it. Big stride forward, so that might help. Nope. It's hitting the top part of middle stump, so he'll have to be on his way. India lose a review too. Really poor choice of shot, I think
back of a length on the stumps, defended to straight midwicket
shortish, a bit of width, slapped to deep point
flat length ball on off stump, pushed to deep point
tossed up outside off, big stretch out for a push into the point region
flat length ball on middle and leg, clipped through square leg
tossed up outside off, driven watchfully to short extra-cover
shortish, close to off stump, makes some room and jabs to the left of short extra
a bit of flight outside off, driven gently to deep cover
full on leg stump, nice stride out to clip to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
shortish outside off, chopped to deep point
floated up wide of off, makes him stretch out for the single to the sweeper
short, fairly wide, cut away a fair distance to the left of the sweeper
tossed up on middle stump, and Kohli brings up his 60th ODI fifty with a drive to long-off. He's barely reacted to the landmark, and you can see why, with India in the situation they're in
flat, leg-stumpish, clipped to backward square leg
length ball outside off, dabbed to short third man
Finally, a boundary. Short, just a touch of width, and Kohli goes deep and cuts it away to beat backward point to his right. First one since the 20th over
a bit of flight outside off, stretches out and pushes into the cover point region
length ball on middle and leg, defended into the on side
back of a length, looks to make room but can't make enough to chop this past backward point
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come and steers to third man
length ball outside off, and Kohli hangs back and punches to the right of deep point
shortish, a bit more width this time, waits and slaps to the left of deep point
back of a length close to off stump, looks to make room to dab to third man, but only manages to chop it down into the pitch beside him
back of a length on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and dabs to short third man
length ball outside off, shuffles across to try and work it leg side, but he plays it too close to short midwicket to get any runs for it
length ball outside off, driven to long-off
full on leg stump, gets forward to clip to the left of short fine leg
back of a length on leg stump, goes back to clip to deep square leg
flat length ball on the pads, clipped to the right of midwicket
back of a length on the legs, clipped into the square-leg region
length ball on off stump, tries to manufacture room to cut but can't find it. Chopped to backward point
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
bouncer, rising steeply over the fourth-stump channel. Shapes to step across and pull, but decides against it at the last moment
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come and jabs into the point region
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, tucked away to the right of deep square leg

edged. Looks to step out and Hazlewood responds by bowling slightly shorter and wider. Knuckleball too. Looks to punch it away through the covers and ends up top-edging it, but it bounces well short of reaching the keeper

ooh, Australia have reviewed for a caught-behind! Back of a length, straightening just a touch in the corridor. Kohli is looking initially to work this with the angle, I think, and then he's adjusting to the movement when the ball zips past his outside edge. Or has it kissed his edge? There's the tiniest of spikes on Ultra-Edge, but it's enough of a spike to reverse the on-field decision and send Kohli back. What a massive strike from Hazlewood!
tossed up on middle stump, makes a bit of room and drives straight, looking for long-off, and he gets the single he wants after Agar's diving stop runs away from him
short outside off, the bounce beats Jadeja's attempted cut
tossed up outside off, stretches out and clips with the spin to midwicket
tossed up wider, stretches out and sweeps to deep backward square leg
flat, angling down leg. Looks to lap-sweep, can only get pad on it
full on middle and off, driven to long-off
back of a length, rising quite steeply towards middle and off. Gets nicely behind it to defend into the on side
length ball straightening along the fourth-stump channel. Pandya gets behind it and adjusts for the movement, playing late in defence
back of a length outside off, shuffles across and punches to point
shortish, close to off stump. Relentless with that line and length. Gets on his toes to ride the bounce and defend with soft hands, drops the ball close to his feet
ooh, a yorker out of the blue. Not sure Pandya expected it, and he seemed late on his attempted defensive jab. The ball sneaks under and doesn't miss off stump by much
shortish outside off, slapped to deep point. Another superb over from Hazlewood
length ball close to off stump, driven down to long-off
slanted across, fairly flat. Gets on the front foot to push into the covers
back of a length on off stump, gets across to work it square on the leg side
full outside off, clipped to long-on
shortish, angling down leg. Looks to step across and pull, only manages a bit of glove on it, and it runs away past the keeper to the fine leg boundary
flat, angling into leg stump, clipped to midwicket. Agar ends an excellent 10-over quota with figures of 2 for 44.
bounce and turn outside off. Jadeja looks to cut and can't get bat to it
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
back of a length. sliding into middle stump, pulled through midwicket
full, clipped to long-on
flat, angling into the stumps, tucked away past midwicket
shortish outside off, chopped to backward point
short and wide and cut away comfortably to deep point
short ball, pulled powerfully behind square and Green makes a phenomenal diving save on the boundary! They only got one. 200cm and he dove full length to his right
short into the ribs, he's back and tucking this behind square
136kph, back of a length on off, he's back and defending to point

135kph, short outside off, he slices a cut in the air over backward point, he didn't nail it but get enough of it, Zampa makes the diving save but his underarm to Henriques missed the mark and allowed three
back of a length wide of off, he chops a cut to backward point
darted into leg, he clips this easily behind square
tossed up, 83kph, he slices a drive in the air but safely to long off
92kph, shorter and wide, he cuts firmly off middle and Green makes another superb save diving to his right at cover-point
darted into leg, he's back and turning this around the corner
88kph, tossed up on off, he defends to cover-point and wants one but Pandya sends him back
88kph, darted through, it slides on, he goes back to cut but is hurried and chops it onto the pitch
back of a length wide of off, he stands up on his toes and punches this firmly to deep cover-point
132kph, bouncer, outside off, he shapes to pull but sways under it
120kph, length slower ball on leg, he glances this to fine leg
126kph, fuller outside off, he mistimes a drive to mid off and they pinch a tight single
117kph, short ball bouncer, he swivels and pulls behind square
pulled through midwicket and Green can't cut this off! It was chest high and he pulled from high to low through midwicket, he didn't nail it but Green couldn't make the save
89kph, flatter on off, he's back and forcing this to long on
sweeps behind square and it races away! Full on leg and he swept it hard, again didn't middle it but it raced to the rope
90kph, full on leg again, he glances this nicely behind square for two more
89kph, tossed up on off, he drives neatly to long off
drifting into leg, 81kph, he's back and working this to midwicket
85kph, fired into leg, he's back and turning this to midwicket
92kph, leg break wide of off, he drives neatly to deep cover-point
tossed up on leg, he whips this to deep midwicket and they put pressure on Agar, running two
85kph short wrong un, he's back and cutting to deep point
quicker leg break, 94kph, he is back and defending
fuller top spinner, 88kph, he drives to long off
94kph shorter on leg, he's back and turning this behind square
128kph, back of a length on off, he's back and working this to midwicket
thrashed wide of mid off! It was a shorter length on off, he shaped to pull and then at the last minute just slapped it wide of mid off! Incredible power
back of a length on off, he pushes this to mid off and they pinch one
good length, wide of off, he leaves this alone
126kph, fuller outside off, he tries to drive but mistimes to cover
123kph, angled into middle, Jadeja squeezes this between bat and pad and wants a single as it rolls away but Abbott races across in his follow through to prevent it
93kph, short ball, pulled in the air to wide long on and Green makes the save on the bounce
full on off, he paddle sweeps to fine leg to rotate the strike
full and wide, 91kph, he has to reach out a long way to square drive to deep point
93kph, shorter on the hip, he pulls to wide fine leg
95kph, leg break, wide of off, he pushes this to cover-point
86kph, wrong un wide of off, he late cuts but straight to short third man
126kph, half volley outside off, he drives back to the bowler
115kph, back of a length outside off, he's standing up to drive to long on and brings up his 50 from 55 balls. he gets a nice ovation
120kph, yorker speared into leg, but he gets inside it and glances this to fine leg
127kph, short and wide, he places a cut shot straight to backward point. Either side it would have been four
112kph very wide and full, he drives off the toe of the bat to cover
late cut past short third man! Clever shot. 111kph slower ball off cutter, it just sat in the surface, there was enough width and placed the late cut nicely past the man in the circle
136kph, low full toss outside off, he sits right back to launch but is forced to just drive along the ground to long on
back of a length wide of off, he angles the blade and runs it to third man
136kph, low full toss outside off, drilled along the ground to long on
138kph, back of a length angled across, he is back and late cutting to third man
length crushed back at Hazlewood and he just ducks under it! Abbott did well coming around from long on to save four
drilled through cover! Amazing power. It was a low full toss wide of off, with fast hands, he reached out and thumped it past cover and the sweeper had no chance
Finch nearly produces a direct hit! Hardik was in trouble. He would have been out. Jadeja drove it to cover, Finch fielded and fired at the striker's and just missed. Pandya was short
slower ball, he sits back and pushes this slowly to long on and calls two immediately, Smith has to run in a fair way and they get back easily
short slower ball bouncer outside off, Pandya was deceived and ended up leaving it
leading edge flies safely to wide third man! Leg cutter outside off, he closed the face trying to work into the leg side, got a leading edge and it flew between short third man and backward point
upper cut over point! Sensational shot. Short outside off, he backed away, gave himself room and slapped it up and over point into the dug out
glanced fine! This was angled down leg and it was easy picking, he just tucked it fine with fine leg very wide. This outfield is rapid
139kph, yorker outside off, he squeezes this away to cover
141kph wide yorker, he jumped outside off and pushed it towards long off and they get two
wide yorker, too wide. Pandya stayed still this time. Clever batting
low full toss, he sits back and whips this to deep midwicket
launched over midwicket onto the hill! Great strike. Hazlewood missed his length, it was in the slot and Jadeja smashed it high over midwicket.
wide yorker, perfectly bowled, beats the edge

lofted over point! How did that go all the way?! 135kph, full ball outside off, he cleared the front leg and sliced this high towards deep point, Maxwell was on the rope and looked for all money to have it cover and it just kept going and going and going and it landed in the seats behind him
knee high full toss wide of off, Pandya hits it one handed to deep cover-point but straight to the man on the bounce
Jadeja gets it behind square! Great skill. He predicted the wide yorker, still outside off and got it behind square with the bottom hand
short ball pulled over square leg! Got him again! He again went wide but short this time and he was able to pull this behind square
short and wide and late cut past backward point! Bad bowling but brilliant from Jadeja. He brings up 50 and delivers the trademark Jaddu celebration.
Pulled over square into the crowd! Short, chest high, he got inside it and thumped a pulled shot high over the fence
swing and a miss. 136kph, angled across, full, and he tried to heave against the angle but missed
wide yorker, he drives straight to cover
140kph, full angled across, he slices this off a thick edge to wide third man
138kph, wide yorker, he carves this behind point and Henriques has to scurry on the rope to make the save
full outside off, yorker length, he mistimes a drive to long off who is right back on the rope and they get two
137kph, yorker on off, he plays the helicopter shot but along the ground to long on and they run well again for two more

drilled to deep cover and Agar can't get there! It just dropped on him and half-volleyed into his body but he kept it to two. He was a chance for a moment because it was hit so well to him but it didn't carry
wide full toss, he gets a thick edge flies to third man and Labuschagne gets around from his wide posting to make a great save at full length
136kph, wide yorker, he miscues, dragging this to long and they pinch two
driven nicely past mid off! 132kph, wide low full toss, Jadeja is sitting back and waiting and he just places this between mid off and cover
swing and a miss and Pandya pinches a bye as Carey's underarm missed. Good length, wide of off and Jadeja tried to hit this to Parliament in the centre of Canberra, but missed.
134kph, wide yorker, well bowled, he squeezes this out to backward point and Zampa misfields to allow two
131kph, wide yorker, he can't get under, he drags it to long on for two, Pandya goes to his highest ODI score of 92 to end the innings
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
ooh, what a delivery. Back of a length, angling in, pitching in the fifth-stump channel, jagging away off the seam, and then swinging late as well, after it's passed the batsman's uncertain jab
and again. This one pitches even closer to off stump before straightening past the edge. Labuschagne had to play at it, and the length just left his feet frozen

ooh, Bumrah likes this pitch. Similar line to the first two balls, but this keeps going with the angle with some extra bounce. Labuschagne does well to get on his toes, ride the bounce, and defend it by his feet
onto the pads, clipped to the left of long leg
back of a length outside off, jags in off the seam this time and sneaks past the inside edge as Labuschagne looks to punch through cover. Kept a little low too
back of a length, slanting across to off stump, punched to mid-off
full, angling across to off stump, tiny bit of shape back in. Gets forward for a push to mid-off
drops short now, and it only gets up to about stomach height, just outside off. Finch swivels and dumps it over the forward square leg boundary. Welcome to international cricket!
back of a length close to off stump, chopped into the point region
short, but this time it gets up to chest height, and closer to Finch's body with the line. Helped down to fine leg for a single
short, some width too, but the angle away from the right-hander defeats Labuschagne, who looks to cut without getting across with his back foot
and again, past the outside edge. Bumrah angles it in, hits that hard length in the corridor, and straightens it past a hesitant defensive prod
slightly fuller length, angling in towards off stump, defended back towards the bowler
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and steers to third man
shortish, not too much width, but that's a super shot from Labuschagne, stands tall and frees his arms through a back-foot drive between backward point and cover point
back of a length, sixth-stump line, left alone
length ball slanting across towards off stump, gets forward to punch towards cover point
shot! That isn't a short ball, it's on off stump, and Finch is waiting for something marginal like that, and he simply half-swivels and swats it between midwicket and mid-on. Dismissive
back of a length on off stump, punched to short extra-cover
length ball angling in towards off stump, gets forward to defend into the on side
big appeal for lbw as Finch steps across and looks to whip one through square leg. I think the impact was well outside off stump, though
back of a length, angling in towards off stump, defended to short extra-cover
there, again. This could even be outswing. Length ball, fifth-stump channel, and it veers away against the angle as Labuschagne pokes at it with an angled bat. Beaten comprehensively
again that movement, and this time Labuschagne pulls out of his stroke halfway and leaves it alone
back of a length outside off, waits on it and carves to third man

fullish, angling in towards off stump, and that's some timing. Just stands there, stays slightly leg-side of the ball, and slices a six over point. He may have wanted to hit over cover, and the bat may have spun in his hands
back of a length on off stump, clipped watchfully to midwicket
length ball on the stumps, clipped down to mid-on

Natarajan on the board. India's first wicket in Powerplays this series. What a moment for Natarajan. Not the most spectacular one. Not something you see when you dream of a maiden wicket. This is short, just outside off, Marnus wants to pull, but gets a bottom edge onto the wicket. This is short and angling away, could he have cut instead of pulled?
short of a length, outside off, left alone
fuller, angling in, defended to short midwicket
short of a length, just outside off, Smith shuffles across to work this to short midwicket again
fuller, but not driving length, Smith is back and across to push this back to him
wicket-maiden for Natarajan. What a start. This one holds its line in front of off, squares him up, and takes a soft outside edge to point
rare outright bad ball from Bumrah, wide half-volley. Finch gets forward and drives between cover and mid-off
length ball close to off stump, defended with an open face to backward point
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped to mid-on. Hung in the air briefly but no worries for Finch
back of a length, skids through with maybe a bit of inward movement, and beats the attempted flick. Hits him on the thigh pad

edged, and put down! He's been getting the ball to nip away in the corridor all through this spell, and he hits the perfect length with this ball, full enough so the movement finds the edge rather than beating it. Finch is half-forward, and he has a half-hearted prod at it, and the ball goes to the right of slip, at about shin height, and Shikhar Dhawan gets both hands to it but can't hold on
back of a length, angling down leg, and Finch misses his flick but picks up four leg-byes to the fine leg boundary. Insult to injury
full, angling into off stump, punched to mid-on

length ball, aiming towards top of off. Steps across and clips towards midwicket. No-ball too, but they could have got a wicket with it. Pandya moved quickly to his right at midwicket while Finch was slow to take off from the non-striker's end. The throw misses, though, and Finch can breathe
Natarajan goes for the yorker, and Finch, probably expecting it, looks for the reverse-ramp past short third man. Misses, and the ball rolls down to the keeper off the back pad
length ball angling into the stumps. Half-hearted appeal as Finch walks across to flick and misses. The impact, again, was outside off stump. Ball ricochets wide of slip for a leg-bye
length ball angling into the stumps. Steps across, meets it in line with off stump, and nearly beats short fine leg with the flick. Bumrah throws himself to his left and saves three runs
he's been seeing Finch stepping across his stumps repeatedly. Looks for the full one on leg stump to try and bowl him behind his legs, but ends up firing down a leg-side wide
shortish, down the leg side, Finch looks to pull and misses
overpitched. Wide-ish half-volley, and Finch shuffles down the pitch and drives smoothly to the right of extra-cover
length ball angling in towards off stump, steps forward and across and clips through square leg

dropped again. This is a much more difficult catch. Fullish, angling into off stump and straightening slightly. Pushes at it with firm hands, and it pops back to Bumrah at around chest height, to his left. Sticks his hand out, but the ball doesn't stick
back of a length outside off, jabbed into the point region
length ball, fourth-stump channel. Finch looks to get forward but his weight isn't fully forward as he looks to punch this down the ground. Ends up inside-edging into his pad
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers

what a charmed life Finch is leading. Length ball angling into off stump, and this one bounces out of nowhere. Straightens slightly too. Looks to work it with the angle, and the ball pops up in the air, off the leading edge, but into no-man's land to the right of square leg
length ball outside off, left alone

go on, just throw your bat at everything. Nothing's going to go to hand anyway. Down the track to a length ball that nips away off the pitch, and he drives with bat far out in front of his body. Thick edge, flies in the air to the right of backward point
length ball on off stump, defended back to the bowler
down the track again, Thakur shortens his length slightly and Finch flat-bats to extra-cover
looks to step out again, and Thakur gets this one to nip back in slightly to beat the flick. Half-hearted appeal, the ball was probably heading down leg
length ball close to off stump, gets forward for a push to the left of short extra
fullish, angling into middle and off. Lets it come and clips to the right of midwicket
tossed up slow on off stump, skips out and clips with the turn to short midwicket
short, turns down leg, and Smith plays the old Tendulkar paddle sweep (pretty much a straight drive behind the wicket) past the keeper
down the track but he can't get to the pitch of this loopy one just outside leg stump. Looks to flick and the ball hits his front pad
down the track, and again he fails to reach the pitch of the ball. Wrong'un this time, past the other side of his flick to hit him on the body
back of a length, spins down leg slightly, goes back and works it to deep backward square leg
short on leg stump, rocks back and swats a pull to deep backward square leg
full outside off, a bit of late outswing. Driven firmly to mid-off

got him! No 62-ball hundred today for Smith. Not the most aesthetically pleasing dismissal, but Thakur won't care. Back of a length, angling down leg, and Smith, who's shuffled a long way across as he always does, looks to glance it fine but only manages to tickle it to the keeper. Tons of bowlers have tried getting him out like that, or with a leg gully in place, and they've usually failed
angling down leg again, but no shuffle from Henriques. Just clips it away neatly to the fine leg boundary
back of a length, a bit of width, and Henriques stands tall and slaps it between backward point and cover point. What a start!
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-off
dips onto a good length on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
full, on the pads, clipped to square leg
goes back to a fairly full ball pitching on off stump, picks the direction of turn and clips to midwicket
down the track now, gets close to this leg-stumpish ball and works it away through square leg
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to deep backward square leg

beaten on the flick, not much of an lbw appeal because this was spinning down leg. A bit of flight and dip, and the ball beat the inside edge. Oh, hang on, India have reviewed! Kuldeep has bowled a better length through this over than he did in his first over, and Finch, who's got a big stride forward, simply fails to get to the pitch as he looks to flick. Turns sharply to hit his front pad, and it's turned too sharply. Missing leg stump is the verdict of ball-tracking

back of a length close to off stump, stabbed to the left of backward point, where Jadeja makes his customary diving save. Henriques took off for a single and then had to turn around hurriedly and throw himself into the crease. Direct hit may have been interesting. As it happens, he's called for a change of pads. Not sure what's gone wrong with his current pair
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to play that to mid-on off the back foot
shortish, a bit of width, cut away but can't beat backward point
length ball on off stump, clipped to mid-on
back of a length outside off, straightens slightly and maybe stops on Henriques. Defended into the covers
ooh, some extra bounce here. Shortish, a bit of width, but the bounce defeats the attempted cut
tossed up on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
flighted ball on middle stump, clipped to long-on
down the track to another tossed-up ball on leg stump, flicks it away to deep midwicket
shortish, turning quickly down the leg side, whipped to deep square leg
length ball spinning in towards off and middle, stays back and punches it back to the bowler

length ball, pitching on off stump and spinning further away. Waits on the back foot, watches it turn, and then punches to long-off. Clearly hanging back and looking to play it off the pitch, is Henriques. Kuldeep will want to find ways to bring him forward
back of a length, sliding on towards off stump, punched to extra-cover
tossed up slow and wide, looks to step across and sweep. Through it too soon and he's hit on the back
back of a length on off stump, whipped to deep square leg
length ball outside off, gets forward and blocks to short cover
flat slider going down leg. Looks to sweep and misses. Appeal for caught behind from Rahul, who's done well to move there and collect. Just brushed the flap of the pad
sweeps again, but can't beat the man at backward square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, gets forward and clips it away fine
down the track and he goes too early. Kuldeep spots him and bowls it shorter  and quicker. Ends up deliberately padding it away. Was in no danger of hitting the stumps from left-arm over, of course
quickish again, and Finch quickly picks the line, which is outside leg, and uses the pace to sweep it firmly to the right of the deep backward square leg fielder

down the track now and the ball lands just short of where he wants it, but he goes through with his big shot anyway. Doesn't middle it, and it lands a few feet short of the rope as long-on sprints to his left
down the track and again he's not to the pitch. Clipped to midwicket
tossed up outside off, gets forward and blocks into the off side
darted down leg, he tries to sweeps and gloves it over the keeper's head and it runs away for two
93kph, this holds up in the surface, he pushes back to the bowler
90kph, darted into off, Finch defends
a slog sweep over backward square! What a shot to bring up another half-century!. Outside off and he hammers this over the man on the rope!
gets away with a top edge! Short ball, he got a top edge and it balloons high in the air but lands safe between short fine running back and deep square coming in
shorter length, he stands tall and drives to long on
tossed up on middle, he defends from the crease
shorter length, spinning back into leg, he gets deep in the crease to work it to fine leg with the spin
wrong un, 78kph, pitching on off, Finch has to adjust late to defend
tossed higher, 79kph, he drives firmly back to the bowler
shorter length, he gives room and drives forcefully off the back foot to cover-point
full on leg, he sweeps but it comes off the toe of the bat and runs forward of square
shorter outside off, he's back and cutting to point
91kph, tossed up outside off, he slices a drive to backward point
shorter, darted into leg, he's back and pulling to deep square
spins sharply past the edge. Ripping delivery. Drifted in and gripped away past the edge
shorter length, he's back and tucking this forward of square
95kph, shorter, darted into leg, it takes him on the thigh pad
139kph, back of a length, Finch is on the walk and works this just midwicket and they pinch two. Outrageous running to pinch two there
139kph, shorter length, chest high, he swivels and pulls to wide fine leg
pulled powerfully between midwicket and mid off! Fractionally short outside off, he was so quick to spot the length, rocked back and smoked it
139kph, full on leg, he clips this to midwicket's right, Kohli dives to his right to knock it down but can't reel it in to get a throw off

pulled forward of square! Iyer gets there on the rope at full stretch to his left but it rolls off his hand into the rope. Too short from Thakur, chest high and Finch was all over it slapping it forward of square
angled into the hip, he glances this with ease to fine leg
picked up and deposited over wide long on! Tossed up in the arc of Finch and from outside off, with one stride forward and drags it over wide long on, one bounce four
drifting into leg, he works this off the front foot to midwicket's right
94kph, yorker wide of off, he plays over it and Rahul completes the take very well
95kph, full outside off, he drives straight to cover
tossed up, more spin, he slices this to backward point
96kph, angled into middle, he gets a thick edge onto pad
an appeal for lbw but it was bat first, just. He was pressing forward, got an inside edge, squeezing it onto pad. It was also outside the line
caught at midwicket! A pull shot picks out Dhawan! Back of a length, cross seam, similar to one in the previous over that he nailed, but this one he hit knee high to Dhawan. Big wicket
136kph, bouncer over leg, Green ducks under it
beaten, fending outside off at a back of a length delivery
beaten again by 138kph late outswinger. What a delivery. Green is nervous and played the wrong line
138kph, short ball, he pulls to fine leg to get off the mark
94kph, darted in, almost a yorker, he jams the bat down
shorter length, he's back and defending
drifting in and shooting through, he's back to defend
back of a length he defends
darted into leg, he works this off his pads to midwicket
drifting into leg, he defends
beaten by another cross seamer that shapes! Good length, it angled in and went away a touch to beat the edge
back of a length, wide of off, he's back and across and he defends with soft hands to get off strike
Finch on the walk, 137kph back of a length, he pulls neatly wide of fine leg for two
cross seam, 136kph, good length on middle, he defends
short and wide, he cuts firmly to backward point
good length, top of off, he defends
darted into middle, he defends on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and slicing this to backward point for a single

holes out to long on! The dot balls on Green has built the pressure on Finch and he holes out> He's tried to launch this down the ground, he miscued to Dhawan at long on and he nearly spilled it but was able to hold on rolling to the ground
full outside off, he lap sweeps behind square
slog sweep for six! in the slot, he was down on one knee and hoisted this high over deep midwicket. Superb strike. And Jadeja over-stepped!
He tries the slog sweep again, it was fired quicker, he skied it over mid on for a couple
94kph, back of a length on off, he is squared up in a tangle
shorter stock ball, Carey tries to reverse sweep early, gets it off the glove
an edge trying to drive, gets a thick edge past slip and he pushes hard for two
80kph, flatter and pushed through, he got back and cuts to backward point
83kph, shorter length, he's back and mistiming a cut to point
wrong un, he plays back and gets a leading edge but it lands safe. He didn't pick that
stock ball spinning into Green, he's back and giving room to push to a gap at cover for one
darted into off, he drives back to the bowler
98kph, angled into leg, he tucks this around the corner
darted back of a length into leg, he works to midwicket
fired into leg again, he picks out midwicket once more
attempted reverse sweep, he missed but it hits the pad outside the line
full on middle, he exposes leg stump and paddles to wide fine leg
tossed up outside off, he drives straight to cover
lovely delivery, spinning away, he pushes on the up to cover
a slog sweep against the turn to the vacant deep midwicket! Tossed up in the arc, he hits against the turn, off the toe of the bat but gets enough of it to find the rope
tossed up outside off, he reaches out and defends
a top edge trying to sweep, it flies over the keeper for a couple. He was fortunate. There was extra bounce and it was lucky to land safe
shorter and slightly wider, he cuts straight to backward point
131kph, back of a length, he defends with soft hands into the off side and Carey races through
130kph, full on leg, he clips this with the angle to mid on

missed by Kohli at mid off! It goes for four! Tough chance on the circle! Carey checked a drive on the up to mid off, Kohli jumped a long way in the air and stuck the right hand up but he tipped it over the bar like a goalkeeper and it rolled away for four. Tough chance.
length ball outside off, he drives on the up to deep cover
full outside off and Green tries to launch over midwicket, a big swing and miss but it was well wide of off
133kph, full angled, into leg, he clips this to midwicket
wrong un, he's back and cramped but he forces it to deep cover-point
cracking back foot drive through cover-point! He picked the wrong un this time, got back, gave himself room and cracked it into the gap with no one back square on the off side
fuller and wider, he square drives on one knee but picks out point
steps outside off, he paddles a ball off middle very fine for a couple

caught at deep backward square! Superb catch by Jadeja! Full outside leg, he sweeps in the air, flat behind square, it curved in the air, Jadeja ran in from well behind square and took an excellent catch diving forward. Green departs
tossed up on off, he leans down and paddle sweeps behind square with control
130kph, bouncer, he swivels and controls the pull to keep it down infront of square
133kph, bouncer, well directed, he sways underneath it
134kph, back of a length outside off, he jumps back and opens the face to run to third man
132kph, low full toss on middle, he mistimes this to midwicket
good length, 133kph, wide of off, he drives on the up to cover
132kph, good length, top of off, he drives on the up to cover
slower ball off cutter, it stays low and he plays over the top of it
132kph, back of a length on off, he stays leg side and defends to cover-point for a single
137kph, back of a length wide of off, he gets a thick inside edge that runs past leg stump! A touch fortunate there Carey
138kph angled down leg and it's called wide! They appealed for caught behind. It certainly looked like it came off the thigh guard
137kph, short ball, only gets up chest high, he takes his eyes of it but pulls to fine leg without trouble
off the glove and just over Rahul! Only 136kph apparently, it looked like 146kph, too quick for Carey, bounced off his gloves and over Rahul
good length zipping in, hits the back thigh guard
139kph, back of a length on middle, he's back and defending to mid on
92kph, full outside off, he slices a drive to deep poin
94kph, full on middle, he sweeps to deep backward square
darted into off, 93kph, he sits back and defends
tossed up in the arc, he goes to slog sweep but mistimes it through forward square
sensational check drive straight over the umpire! He shimmied leg side and held his shape superbly to loft straight down the ground
sweeps behind square for a single
back of a length, angling into off stump, blocked into the covers
full, angling into the legs, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, whipped to midwicket with a twirl of the wrists
short, angling down leg. Looks to pull and misses. Wanted to bowl the bouncer at his front shoulder, I guess, and missed his line marginally
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
short, gets it to climb towards Carey's shoulder, but he's controlled his pull beautifully, swivels and simply helps it to the right of the long leg fielder, ensuring he keeps it down
length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
nicely played. That's fired in fairly full on middle and leg, and he makes himself room for an inside-out chip to the right of deep cover
length ball on middle stump, brings out the reverse-sweep in front of deep square leg

bang. The open stance allows him easier access to this sort of line. Length ball, angling into middle stump or so, and he gets forward, head over the ball, and absolutely shovels it over the midwicket boundary with super quick hands

back of a length on off stump, and Maxwell's hit this one out of the park too. Quick feet to get on the back foot with hips open, and even quicker hands to pull it waay over midwicket. It's landed on the stadium roof and rolled off the premises altogether
that's the line. Slower, wide line outside off, makes Maxwell reach out to drive and the ball turns to beat the outside edge
and again, beats him with sharp turn from that wide line. Maxwell goes hard at the attempted flat-bat drive and misses
length ball, looks to work it into the leg side and misses. Aborted lbw appeal because it pitched outside leg
length ball on middle stump, shows the full face to push down to long-on
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to the left of deep square leg, where Kuldeep looks up too early and fluffs his pick-up. Has to run back and ensure he doesn't concede a boundary
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
full on off stump, punched down the ground, past the stumps and to the left of mid-off
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
tossed up wide of off, and Maxwell doesn't miss out this time. Lofted over extra-cover, and he finds the gap to the right of deep cover
full outside off, driven with a lot of bottom hand down to long-off
sees Carey stepping away to make room and follows him with a quick, full one. Pushed down to mid-off

gone, is he? That run wasn't on at all. They've gone up to the third umpire, but you'd think there's no need. Carey looked to sweep one pitching just outside leg, and missed, and the ball rolled into the square leg region. Carey sets off quickly, and he's sent back by Maxwell, but too late to beat the underarm throw to Rahul. Kohli was the fielder sprinting in from midwicket
full on middle stump, clipped back to the bowler
full again, almost in the blockhole. Clipped past the diving bowler, down to long-on
back of a length at the hip, clipped to midwicket
length ball angling across, looks to drive with an angled bat and inside-edges into his front pad
length ball on leg stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball close to off stump. Not wide or short enough to cut, and he ends up chopping it hard into the pitch
fullish, angling across, pushed towards mid-off for the quick single
length ball close to off stump, punched with an open face through point
shortish, angling into off stump, pulled to deep square leg
length ball outside off, makes a bit of room to drive to deep cover
fullish, angling into off stump from round the wicket. Opens his bat face and steers it a long way to the left of the cover sweeper. Excellent placement
there's the Natarajan yorker. Homing in on Agar's front toe, and he looks to jam down on it and gets the tiniest of inside edges that sends the ball scooting past leg stump for four
length ball on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, and Maxwell puts it away. Lets it come on and jabs it between backward point and short third man. A difficult field to bowl to against a set batsman
shortish outside off, slapped to deep point
very full, quicker ball in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed to short cover
tossed up on middle stump. Doesn't get a stride in, ends up stuck in the crease. Flicked to midwicket
full on off stump, driven to short cover
tossed up on leg stump, Maxwell brings out the reverse-sweep but can't beat deep point
back of a length fairly wide of off stump. Agar doesn't pick the wrong'un. He was shaping to slap it through point, maybe, and ends up playing a hurried flick to long-on
on the pads, nudged into the square leg region
big wide down the leg side. Wanted to angle it into his feet and deny him room
low full-toss close to off stump. Punched back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat. Was probably aiming to go through cover
full-toss, about thigh-high, on the stumps. Steps across and whips it to fine leg
slower ball, fullish on leg stump. Clipped to midwicket
looks for the yorker, ends up bowling a low full-toss on off stump, clipped towards midwicket, who moves quickly to his right to stop it but lets the ball get away from him slightly
slower bouncer over off stump, and Maxwell picked it late. Was looking to hook, initially, then he pulled out and semi-ducked to get himself under it
shortish outside off, slapped to deep point
tossed up close to off stump, whipped down to long-on

what. A. Shot. Maxwell hits more reverse-sweeps for six than pretty much everyone else, and this time he had to manufacture even more power given that Kuldeep dangled it up slow, and it also landed a little shorter than you might think is ideal for that shot. No worries, says Maxwell, I'll just whack that into the second tier, in front of square
fuller and flatter, whipped to long-on
tossed up on off stump, clipped to long-on
full on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket

goes for the yorker, and Maxwell was expecting that, sitting quite deep in his crease on off stump. Simply brings those wrists into play and whips it over the midwicket boundary to bring up another superlative half-century
low full-toss on off stump, and Maxwell's eased it for four, just a push between mid-off and extra-cover
goes a bit wider with the yorker, and Maxwell collapses his back knee to get down low and steer it to deep backward point

shortish outside off, and now Agar joins in the fun. Not bowling to his field, is Natarajan. Cuts it to the left of backward point, and the sweeper is well in front of square, so no way is he getting to that
goes for the leg-stump yorker now, and Agar makes himself room and drives to long-off

looks to go wide and outside Maxwell's hitting arc, slanting it away from him from over the wicket. It's hard to control the line while doing that, and Maxwell shoulders arms as the ball crosses the tramline
length ball outside off, opens his bat face and steers to deep point
slower bouncer outside off, Maxwell tennis-forehands it down the ground to long-on
short outside off, slapped to deep point
slower bouncer again, over off stump, and Maxwell thinks of playing the ramp to third man, then decides to leave it. It's called wide anyway
looks to follow up with the leg-stump yorker, and he misses his mark by inches. Maxwell looked to step across and help it fine, and couldn't put bat to it

bam, the bails go flying all over the place. That elastic right arm goes beyond the vertical and whangs it full and fast, at the base of the stumps. Maxwell looks to make room and carve it through the covers, working against the angle. He misses, and Bumrah - who's bowled so well with no luck all this while - hits. A crucial, crucial blow
fullish on off stump, steps across and clips it to deep backward square leg
shortish, close to off stump. Hops to ride the bounce and defend it
in the blockhole close to off stump, stabbed into the point region with an open face
low full-toss on off stump, jabbed down the ground to long-off
in the blockhole, clipped straight back to the bowler
nearly a yorker again, pitches just outside leg, beats the flick and hits him on the pad
length ball on off stump. No feet from Abbott, just pushes at it and slices it towards backward point
full on leg stump, driven to long-on. Natarajan may have got a foot to it to slow it down, after which he slipped and landed awkwardly, almost twisting his right ankle. He's fine, though

good ball. Agar looks to make room and carve through the off side. Natarajan's low full-toss doesn't give him the length to work with, and he ends up dragging it down towards long-on. Just four off the over, so an excellent comeback, albeit with Maxwell out of the picture
slower length ball on off stump, clipped towards deep midwicket
looks for the wide yorker, ends up bowling a wide, reasonably high full-toss. Steered down to third man
slower ball on off stump, clipped to long-on
shortish, slanting away from the left-hander, slashed to third man
leg-stump yorker, misses the flick and prompts an lbw appeal. Probably sliding down leg

slower bouncer, and Thakur has the breakthrough. Third wicket for him. Gets up just around shoulder height, angling in and cramping Abbott for room, and he plays a half-hearted pull, only managing to lob it to the keeper off his glove. India's quicks have really pulled this back in the last three overs

and he gets the last recognised batsman! Boundaries were needed, and this ball - more or less in the slot, off-stumpish - had to be attacked. Made room to go over cover, but he simply couldn't find the elevation, and the fielder pouches it with both hands in front of his chest
in the blockhole on off stump, clipped into the midwicket region
shortish, slanting across the right-hander. Jabbed into the point region
bouncer, over middle and off. Looks to make room and ramp it over the keeper, makes no contact
in the blockhole, angling into leg stump. Makes room and squeezes it out to backward point
full on off stump, clipped to deep square leg
yorker outside off, and Zampa looks to reverse-ramp and fails to make contact
full outside off, carved to deep point
in the blockhole on off stump, makes room and drives to the left of Kohli at deep point
shot. Full again, on leg stump, clears his front leg and swipes it down to long-on
low full-toss on leg stump, knuckleball too. Zampa makes room, adjusts for the lack of pace, and jabs it past the bowler, down towards long-off
length ball outside off, slapped to deep point
leg-stump yorker, almost. Very low full-toss, and he makes room and stabs it towards backward point
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Digs into the pitch and turns like an offbreak. Swings too early into the pull, and then the ball turns and rolls down to Rahul

big appeal for lbw, given. Zampa shuffles across and Bumrah bowls it full and straight. He misses the flick, and it looked pretty plumb, given especially how deep he was in his crease, but Zampa has reviewed anyway. No edge on it. Both feet inside the crease, and it's smashing into leg stump, so India have wrapped up a victory that will bring them quite a bit of comfort, after five successive ODI losses, and seven in a row across formats.
